page.title: 09Homes in Well
page.content: All the homes in the village are comfortable,well decorated,mostly with fitted carpets and suitable furniture. An open fire is still usual tho' many use background central heating.Most have modern aids-freezers are a boon to store fruit and vegetables from the garden. Mixers & food processors are used & several have microwave ovens. Preparing food is very important - home baking is valued - many have a baking morning,and all have 1 & often 2 cooked meals a day.Food given to various events is always of a high standard due to W.I. influence perhaps or from the older women who were formerly in service. Mothers seem content to stay at home with young children.No child comes home regularly to an empty house,and no child is overweight.The W.I. meet monthly at Well or Snape.
